comments:
I have installed I20050617 from scratch (but re-used my old workspace).

I have two servers defined (Tomcat 5.5 and Tomcat 4.1).

When creating a new Dynamic Web Project the "Target server" dropdown box only
shows Tomcat 5.5. The "New..." button just does nothing.

I have also tried setting "Module version" to 2.3, since Tomcat 4.1 is a 2.3
container.

Could not reproduce in Windows XP environment, please attach the error 
from .log  file

There is no .log at all.

I just tried again:

- downloaded the latest I20050617 again (noticing that there was a new one in
the meantime)
- installed everything from scratch again
- this time, created a new workspace
- in addition to the already installed JDK 1.5.0_03, I added a JDK 1.4.2_08
runtime ("Installed JREs") 
- added the two Server Runtimes Tomcat 5.5 (using JRE 1.5) and 4.1 (using JRE
1.4) , in this order ("Installed Server Runtime Environments")
- added the Servers view to my Java perspective (don't like the J2EE perspective)
- added two Servers Tomcat 5.5 and 4.1 to the Servers view, in this order
- File->New->Project->(expand Web)->J2EE Web Project->(expand "Hide Advanced")

Try to change Tomcat 5.5. This is not possible, because this is the only Server
in the List.

Ok, sorry, there is a log, but it does not contain anything suspicious:

Did you try again to set "Module Version" to 2.3, as mentioned  in your 
original defect statement, since the default is 2.4 and Tomcat 4.1 doesn't 
support 2.4

I just tried around some more, including some more switching between Module
versions.

The key is, you have to change the Module version twice for Tomcat 4.1 to show
up. So, if you set it from 2.4 to 2.2, nothing changes. If you then set it from
2.2 to 2.3, everything is okay and both Tomcat 4.1 and 5.5 are contained in the
list.

This is showing up in the console:
